article.title: Magnetic moments of the spin-${3\over 2}$ doubly heavy baryons

multiple_choice_question.text: Figure 1 depicts the tree-level diagrams contributing to the magnetic moments of spin-3/2 doubly charmed baryons. What do the double solid lines, solid dot, and black square represent in these diagrams?
choices: Double solid line: spin-3/2 baryon; Solid dot: second-order coupling; Black square: third-order coupling
Double solid line: spin-1/2 baryon; Solid dot: second-order coupling; Black square: fourth-order coupling
Double solid line: spin-3/2 baryon; Solid dot: first-order coupling; Black square: third-order coupling
Double solid line: spin-3/2 baryon; Solid dot: second-order coupling; Black square: fourth-order coupling

multiple_choice_question.text: Figure 2 shows the one-loop diagrams contributing to the magnetic moments of spin-3/2 and spin-1/2 doubly charmed baryons. What do the different line styles represent in these diagrams?
choices: Double solid line: spin-3/2 baryon; Single solid line: spin-1/2 baryon; Dashed line: photon; Wavy line: pseudoscalar meson.
Double solid line: spin-1/2 baryon; Single solid line: spin-3/2 baryon; Dashed line: pseudoscalar meson; Wavy line: photon.
Double solid line: spin-3/2 baryon; Single solid line: spin-1/2 baryon; Dashed line: pseudoscalar meson; Wavy line: photon.
Double solid line: spin-1/2 baryon; Single solid line: spin-3/2 baryon; Dashed line: photon; Wavy line: pseudoscalar meson.

multiple_choice_question.text: Equation (53) represents the magnetic moment operator used in the quark model to calculate baryon magnetic moments. What does Î¼_i represent in this equation?
choices: The magnetic moment of the baryon.
The magnetic moment of the i-th quark.
The mass of the i-th quark.
The charge of the i-th quark.
